Key Responsibilities: Ensure full implementation of articulated basic education curriculum, its localization/indigenization, and increase access to learning resources. Coordinate with BLR for screening and selecting potential LREs; monitor delivery and utilization of TXs and TMs.

Lead the Regional Field Technical Assistance Team (RFTAT); formulate regional operational guidelines; coordinate and integrate the provision of technical assistance to SDOs to facilitate quality basic education delivery.
Facilitate formulation and implementation of education plans and policies through research and data management systems. Conduct orientation on enrollment procedures and monitor data collection.
Ensure competent personnel through an efficient training and development system; manage professional development, orientations, and capability-building activities (e.g., PPSSH).
Ensure compliance with standards of quality basic education by assessing, monitoring, and evaluating region and school performances; oversee quality assurance protocols.
Manage health and nutrition sections, education facilities, and special programs and projects.
Provide regional office with efficient administrative services relating to personnel, records, correspondence, supplies, equipment, and custody of property; manage personnel actions for RO employees.
Supervise administrative functions and staff within the division office.
Acquisition of personnel, tracking movement, timely compensation and benefits management, and employee database management.
Management of cash collections, disbursements, liquidations, and preparation of accounting reports.
Receipt, recording, distribution, and safekeeping of official correspondence and documents; records management.
Delivery of basic education assets, supplies, and instructional materials; property and supply management system.
Safety and security of personnel and premises; grounds and building maintenance; motor pool services.
Management of regional financial resources, including accounting, budget, payroll, and reporting services; coordinate with oversight agencies.
Oversee administrative services including asset management, cash, personnel, and records sections at the regional level.
Provide legal advice and render legal opinions to the Regional Director and officials; interpret laws and rules; handle legal and investigation matters.
Manage the ICT System and infrastructure to effectively support operations and ICT-related plans and programs.
Manage communication systems to strengthen relationships with external partners and inform the public of regional accomplishments.
